intro: Cupania madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar cupania, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest ecosystems of Madagascar. Its botanical features make it an important component of the region's flora.
